channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: Epidemic Response Committee to probe decision to extend level 4 lockdown
item.description: National MPs will pursue the case on the Epidemic Response Committee this morning, putting questions to the Ministers for Finance, Small Business, and Employment.

item.title: Covid-19: Live updates from New Zealand and around the world on 21 April
item.description: The three last cruise ships still sailing with passengers will finally dock- and one has had quite the odyssey. Follow RNZ's blog for the latest news.

item.title: Covid-19 lockdown extension: How New Zealand industries, politicians and public reacted
item.description: New Zealanders largely welcomed the government's decision to move to level 3 next week, but there has been some criticism of extending level 4 until then.

item.title: Covid-19 alert level 3: What you need to know
item.description: The national alert level 4 response to the Covid-19 coronavirus began at 11.59pm Wednesday, 25 March and is due to end at 11.59pm on Monday, 27 April.

item.title: Drone footage reveals lockdown from above
item.description: Watch: Drone footage taken in Auckland and Wellington shows few vehicles and an absence of pedestrians during the level 4 lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19: Contact tracing too slow, must be expanded - audit
item.description: Contact tracing needs to increase three- or four-fold as long as the Covid-19 coronavirus remains a health threat, Dr Ayesha Verrall's audit has found.

item.title: Aucklanders react to staying in lockdown another week
item.description: How do New Zealanders feel about spending another week in lockdown? Checkpoint checks in with locals from Auckland's Grey Lynn area.

item.title: Covid-19: Drugs seized at border plummets during lockdown
item.description: Customs seized 70 percent less methamphetamine and 60 percent less MDMA at the border in the first three months of this year, compared to last year.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand on 20 April
item.description: New Zealand's Covid-19 transmission rates have stayed low, and the country has been given a week's notice to prepare to move out of the level 4 lockdown.

item.title: Relaxed seals take over penguin colony during lockdown
item.description: Far more seals than usual are coming ashore in Oamaru during lockdown to relax and sunbathe at the local blue penguin colony.

item.title: Man sentenced to prison for spitting at cop
item.description: A 42-year-old man has been sentenced to 14 days in prison for spitting at a police officer in Rotorua.

item.title: 'Two minutes, two shots': Resident describes police shooting
item.description: An Auckland local living near the scene of a fatal police shooting overnight heard screaming, before a man taunting neighbours to call the police was killed.

item.title: Hawke's Bay Hospital sets up dedicated Covid-19 areas
item.description: With brand new areas for suspected Covid-19 patients and a doubling of intensive care beds, Hawke's Bay Hospital hopes to reassure the public it is safe to seek medical help.

item.title: Live: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world on 20 April
item.description: The Prime Minister has announced New Zealand will move out of level 4 lockdown in a week. Read back through RNZ's Covid-19 updates for 20 April here.

item.title: Call to force social media giants to pay for traditional news media content
item.description: New Zealand should follow Australia's decision to force Facebook and Google to pay for content generated by traditional news media companies, a media expert says.

item.title: Orana Wildlife Park describes appeal response as 'incredible'
item.description: Online donations for Christchurch's Orana Wildlife Park have topped $129,200, as it grapples to afford food, habitat maintenance, heating and vet bills during lockdown.

item.title: Nine new Covid-19 cases as lockdown decision nears
item.description: There are nine new cases of Covid-19 in the country today and no new deaths, the Ministry of Health says.

item.title: Covid-19: Charities face hefty revenue cuts due to lockdown
item.description: The SPCA has taken a hit of about $1 million and the RSA looks likely to lose about $2m, as the lockdown restricts fundraising and gaming trust support.
